summary: Build a blog for computer vision notes with Markdown support and a gentle, paper-textured illustration visual style.
architectural_notes: Homepage typography should use off-white text over a stronger (more opaque) frosted-glass background.
Post detail Markdown content area should include a black frosted-glass layer behind the text, with off-white text for readability.
Desktop background image should be scaled proportionally to fit screen width (avoid horizontal tiling).
Tagging UI (tag chips/filter controls and tags shown on posts) should use a dark theme with high-contrast readable text.
known_issues: Desktop web view: background image tiles horizontally instead of scaling to match screen width.

existing_features.title: Create a public blog UI to present computer vision notes with a home page listing posts and a post detail page for reading a single note.
Add Markdown support for blog content by loading posts from Markdown files stored as static assets, and render Markdown (headings, lists, code blocks, links, images) safely in the post detail page.

Implement the requested visual theme consistently across all pages: a gentle, paper-textured illustration style (soft warm palette, subtle grain/paper texture background, hand-drawn accents), including typography and spacing that feel like reading notes.
Add basic blog ergonomics: a header with the blog title, optional short tagline, and a simple client-side filter/search on the post list page (by title/metadata) to help find notes.
Add the required generated images as static assets and use them in the UI (background texture and a small hand-drawn header illustration) without routing image delivery through the backend.
Add a tag-based browsing/filtering experience on the post list page so users can organize and find notes by tags, using the existing `tags` field from `frontend/public/posts/manifest.json`.
Make tags shown on post previews and on the post detail page clickable so that selecting a tag navigates back to the post list with that tag filter applied.
Support shareable URLs for the tag filter (and existing search query) so tag-filtered views can be bookmarked and restored on page reload.
Replace the current paper texture background image used by the `.bg-paper` class with the user-uploaded image `landing_background.jpg`, and ensure it is served as a static asset from the frontend.

Increase the opacity/strength of the existing frosted-glass UI surfaces and set all text on the homepage (post list page) to off-white, including the page title/subtitle, search UI, tag filter UI, and post preview cards.

In the post detail Markdown content area, add a black frosted-glass layer behind the Markdown text and render all Markdown text in off-white (including headings, paragraphs, lists, blockquotes, inline code, and code blocks).

Update the `.bg-paper` background styling so that on desktop web view the `landing_background.jpg` background image scales proportionally with its width matching the viewport width (no horizontal tiling). Keep the existing mobile/tablet background behavior unless it conflicts with this requirement.

Update the tagging UI to use a dark theme: tag chips on post preview cards, tag chips on the post detail page, and the tag filter bar (including the selected tag state and clear-filter button) should render with dark surfaces and readable light/off-white text while maintaining current tag click behavior and accessibility.

new_feature_requests.summary: Create a blog to publish computer vision notes
Support Markdown files as the content source/format for posts
Apply a gentle, paper-textured illustration visual style/theme
Add tagging to organize notes/posts (assign tags to posts and filter/browse by tag)
Update the site background image/texture to use the user-provided image asset
Adjust UI styling: increase frosted-glass opacity and switch homepage/Markdown text to off-white with a black frosted-glass overlay behind Markdown content
On desktop web, make the background image scale proportionally to match screen width (no horizontal tiling)
Style the tagging/tag filter UI using a dark theme (dark surfaces with readable light text)

projectName: Markdown-based blog for computer vision notes with paper-textured illustration theme
